Base (Private) Module: objects/_pageobject.pyÔÉÅ

Purpose:

This module provides the implementation for the PageObject object.

Platform:

Linux/Windows | Python 3.10+

Developer:

J Berendt

Email:

development@s3dev.uk

Comments:

n/a

class PageObject(content: str = '', pageno: int = 0, parser: object = None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

This class provides the implementation for the PageObject.

For each page in a document, an instance of this class is created, populated and appended into the document‚Äôs pages list attribute.

Parameters:

  • content (str, optional) ‚Äì Page content as a single string. Defaults to ‚Äò‚Äô.

  • pageno (int, optional) ‚Äì Page number. Defaults to 0.

  • parser (object, optional) ‚Äì The underlying document parser object. Defaults to None.

property content: strÔÉÅ

Accessor to the page‚Äôs textual content.

property hastext: boolÔÉÅ

Flag indicating if the content attribute is populated.

property pageno: intÔÉÅ

Accessor to the page number.

Note

This is the page number with regard to the page‚Äôs sequence in the overall document. This is not guaranteed to be the page‚Äôs number per the document‚Äôs page labeling scheme.

property parser: objectÔÉÅ

Accessor to the document parser‚Äôs internal functionality.

Note

The population of this property is determined by the document-type-specific docp parser. If the underlying parsing library has functionality worth preserving and making available to the user, it is stored to this property. Otherwise, this property will remain as None.

property tables: listÔÉÅ

Accessor to the page‚Äôs tables, if parsed.

show() → pdfplumber.display.PageImage[source]ÔÉÅ

Display the page as an image.

Additionally, the return value exposes access to the underlying pdfplumber debugging visualisation methods such as:

  • img.debug_tablefinder()

  • img.draw_*()

  • img.outline_chars()

  • img.outline_words()

  • img.reset()

  • etc.
